subject: Self Care
title: Suffering Is Universal
description: A 60-second lesson on Suffering Is Universal.

hook.text: You think you're the only one struggling. In this exact moment, millions of people feel the same pain you feel.

buildup.text: Common humanity is the recognition that suffering, failure, and imperfection are part of the shared human experience.

discovery.text: Isolation amplifies pain. Knowing others share your struggle doesn't fix it â€” but it removes the loneliness layer.

twist.text: Social media creates the illusion that everyone else is thriving. It's a curated highlight reel, not reality.

climax.text: When you suffer, say: 'This is part of being human. Others feel this too. I'm not alone in this experience.'

punchline.text: You're not uniquely broken. You're universally human.

quiz.question: What is 'common humanity' in self-compassion?
options: Suffering and imperfection are shared human experiences, not personal failures
You should compare your pain to others
